bibl.title: Soo Hoo Wing v. Woolery. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States, District of Washington

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States, for the District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application of Soo Hoo Wing for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington:

Your petitioner respectfully shows that he is a resident of the City of Portland, Oregon, and has so been since June 1892. That since said time your petitioner and his said wife have lived and cohabited together as husband and wife, in the City of Portland, Oregon until the 21st day of January, 1893. That on the said 21st day of January, 1893, while the said Fue Gam was lawfully engaged in the discharge of her duties in her own home in the said City of Portland, State of Oregon, and while in company with your petitioner, she was forcibly abducted, taken and carried away by one D. W. West, and forcibly and against her will and against the will of your petitioner, taken from the State of Oregon and carried to the State of Washington, and there imprisoned in the County Jail of Kings County in the City of Seattle, where she is now confined and imprisoned illegally and against her will.
That said jail is in charge of Woolery Sheriff of said Kings County and the said Fue Gam is now detained and unlawfully held and imprisoned in said jail by said Sheriff.
Your petitioner further shows that the cause of said detention is as follows:

That one J. W. Spriggs a United States Commissioner at said City of Seattle, assuming to be in the discharge of his duty as such Commissioner, has pretended to try the said Fue Gam upon the charge of being a prostitute and of having unlawfully entered the United States from a foreign country, to-wit: from British Colum- bia, for the purpose of prostitution, and of being guilty of living a life of a prostitute since coming to this county as aforesaid, and of being now unlawfully in the United States contrary to and in violation of Section 5 of the Act of the Congress of the United States of America, passed March 3rd,1875, and upon said trial the said Commissioner did pretend to adjudge said Fue Gam guilty as charged in the said complaint, and did adjudge that she be deported from the United States to Beitish Colubmbia.

That said imprisonment is not on account of any other order, judgment or process than that herein set forth, and your peti- tioner further shows that unless the prayer of your petitioner is granted, said order will be executed and the said Fue Gam will be deported forcibly and against her will and unlawfully from the United States to the Province of British Columbia.

And your petitioner respectfully shows that the said Commissioner was without authority to make such order and that the same is illegal and void. That said Fue Gam was never in said State of Washington until taken there forcibly as aforesaid, and was never inthe Province of British Columbia.
Wherefore your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of this Honorable Court directed to the said Woolery,Sheriff of said Kings County,

Washington, directing and commanding him to have the body of said Fue Gam before the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court for the District aforesaid, at the United States Court House in the City of Portland, Oregon, at the time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then be adjudged concern- ing her, the said Fue Gam, together with said Writ and the cause of detention, and that the said Fue Gam may be restored to her liberty.
State and District of Oregon, County of Multnomah.
I, Soo Hoo Wing being first duly sworn, say that I have read the foregoing petition, and that the statements therein contained are true as I verily believe.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 3rd day of February, 1893.
